The second likely category is "Kindle Store" (44) because the paper could be discussing an e-book version of "Mary Anning and the Sea Dragon."

The third likely category is "Magazine Subscriptions" (23) because the paper could be a review or article about a magazine that features Mary Anning and her discoveries.

The fourth likely category is "Toys & Games" (7) because the paper mentions Mary Anning's discovery and her work as a scientist, which could be related to educational toys or games for children interested in paleontology.

The fifth likely category is "Collectibles & Fine Art" (28) because the paper mentions tourists buying shells and stone sea lilies from Mary Anning, which could be considered collectible items or fine art pieces.

prompt:
Title: Mary Anning and the Sea Dragon
Content: While Don Brown's Rare Treasure (reviewed above) took a larger view of Mary Anning's life and work, Atkins zooms in on the girl's first major discovery (at age 12), igniting the scientist's lifelong vocation. Though the narrative begins after the death of Mary's father, his words are still very much alive in her: "Don't ever stop looking, Mary." She knows there is something hidden in the cliffs of Lyme Regis, something more than just the shells and stone sea lilies that the tourists buy from her...
